intro: Hieracium blyttianoides, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers, which are typically arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The plant has basal and upright stems with alternate, heart-shaped to oval leaves that are often hairy. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Hieracium blyttianoides is a perennial herb that thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
